text: Mei Li is a book by Thomas Handforth. Released by Doubleday, it was the recipient of the Caldecott Medal for illustration in 1939.American Library Association: Caldecott Medal Winners, 1938 - Present. URL accessed 27 May 2009. == Plot == This story is about a girl named Mei Li l who ventures out to attend the Chinese New Year festivities with her brother San Yu and is burdened with the task to prove that there are activities for girls, too. ==References== Category:American picture books Category:Caldecott Medal- winning works Category:1938 children's books Category:Children's fiction books Category:Books about China
title: Mei Li
